abstract: Rio Tinto said Friday that it will sell potash projects in Argentina and Canada and its Corumba iron ore mine in Brazil for $1.6 billion to its rival, Vale, as part of a plan to cut debt by $10 billion in 2009.
lead_paragraph: Rio Tinto said Friday that it will sell potash projects in Argentina and Canada and its Corumba iron ore mine in Brazil for $1.6 billion to its rival, Vale, as part of a plan to cut debt by $10 billion in 2009.

headline.main: Rio Tinto to Sell Assets to Vale for $1.6 Billion
